abstract.p: Letter by Craig Delsack responds to June 15 article on home-printed snapshops; says article did unfair comparison of printers

block.p: ''Home-Printed Snapshots Can Be Pristine, if Pricey'' (State of the Art, June 15) unfortunately did not compare apples with apples by pitting the Epson's Stylus Color 860 printer (a four-color printer) to the others. Epson's latest photo-quality printer is the Stylus Photo 870. Not only is the Stylus Photo 870 a true six-color printer, but when it is connected to the U.S.B. port, it is very fast. My 8-by-10 prints are practically indistinguishable from those of a 35-millimeter camera. And the printer can print 4-by-6-inch prints from a roll of paper (like the machines in a one-hour photo store). A great site for consumer reviews of digital photography products is www.pcphotoreview .com.

''Home-Printed Snapshots Can Be Pristine, if Pricey'' (State of the Art, June 15) unfortunately did not compare apples with apples by pitting the Epson's Stylus Color 860 printer (a four-color printer) to the others. Epson's latest photo-quality printer is the Stylus Photo 870. Not only is the Stylus Photo 870 a true six-color printer, but when it is connected to the U.S.B. port, it is very fast. My 8-by-10 prints are practically indistinguishable from those of a 35-millimeter camera. And the printer can print 4-by-6-inch prints from a roll of paper (like the machines in a one-hour photo store). A great site for consumer reviews of digital photography products is www.pcphotoreview .com.
